What features would you like to see in a: As a small business owner, I would like to have a digital banking service that helps me manage my finances more efficiently. Specifically, I would like to see features that allow me to categorize my spending automatically, set and track my financial goals, and get personalized insights and recommendations about my spending habits. It would also be great if the service had an easy-to-use interface for splitting expenses with friends and family. Lastly, mobile check deposit would be a huge plus for me.

How often do you use mobile banking serv: As a busy small business owner, I use mobile banking services almost every day. I rely on mobile banking to check my account balances, transfer funds between accounts, pay bills, and deposit checks. It's convenient and saves me a lot of time.

What would make you switch to a differen: I would switch to a different digital banking service if it offered better features and functionality than my current service. For example, if a new service had more advanced budgeting and savings tools, or if it provided more personalized insights and recommendations about my spending habits, I would definitely consider switching. Additionally, if a new service had better security features or better customer support, that would also be a factor in my decision to switch.

How important is it for you to have freq: As a small business owner, I value frequent engagement with my credit union through their mobile app. It helps me stay up-to-date on my account activity and manage my finances more efficiently. Additionally, if my credit union offers valuable insights and recommendations based on my spending habits, it can help me make better financial decisions. So, I would say that frequent engagement is important to me, but it's not the most important factor when choosing a digital banking service. The features and functionality of the service are more important to me.

What concerns do you have about using a: As a small business owner, I have some concerns about using a new digital banking service. One of my main concerns is security. I want to make sure that my financial information is protected and that the service has strong security features in place to prevent fraud or hacking. Another concern is reliability. I need to be able to access my account information and manage my finances at all times, so the service needs to be reliable and available 24/7. Lastly, I want to make sure that the service is user-friendly and easy to navigate. I don't want to waste time trying to figure out how to use the service or dealing with technical issues.

On a scale of 1-10, how likely are you t: As a small business owner who values digital banking services, and based on the features and benefits of the SmartSpender app, I would rate my likelihood of signing up for the new digital banking service at an 8 out of 10. The app seems to offer the features that I am looking for, such as automatic categorization of spending, personalized insights and recommendations, and goal-setting tools. Additionally, the app's integration with my existing bank accounts, easy-to-use interface, and mobile check deposit are all appealing features. However, my final decision would depend on factors such as security, reliability, and ease of use.

What could we do to make you more likely: To make me more likely to sign up for the new digital banking service, I would like to see more information about the security features of the app. It would be helpful to know what measures are in place to protect my financial information and prevent fraud or hacking. Additionally, it would be great to see some customer reviews or testimonials from other small business owners who have used the service. This would give me more confidence in the app's reliability and ease of use. Lastly, if the credit union offered any incentives or promotions for signing up for the service, such as waived fees or cash back rewards, that would also make me more likely to sign up.
